citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
According to an IACUC Adverse Event and Investigation Report, on November 23, 2023, an animal care technician
completed routine checks and observations of all animals in the room except one rabbit, Rabbit #345. The IACUC report
stated the animal care technician did not observe the rabbit and wrote that the animal was not present on the
observation/food and water consumption log.
On November 24, 2023, another animal care technician went into the rabbit room to complete routine checks and
observations. All the rabbits, including Rabbit #345, were observed and fed. The animal care technician identified that
Rabbit # 345 did not receive routine checks and observations the day prior based upon the November 23rd log entry. The
animal care technician notified the RAF Supervisor and RAF Management, who notified the Principal Investigator and
Attending Veterinarian. The clinical veterinary staff reviewed Rabbit #345 and determined it was in good health.
Daily observation of all animals to assess their health and well-being; provided, however, that daily observations of
animals may be accomplished by someone other than the attending veterinarian is required so that timely and accurate
information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian.
Corrected before the time of inspection through retraining all animal care staff on December 14, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.33(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
According to an IACUC Adverse Event and Investigation Report, on November 23, 2023, an animal care technician 
completed routine checks and observations of all animals in the room except one rabbit, Rabbit #345. The IACUC report 
stated the animal care technician did not observe the rabbit and wrote that the animal was not present on the 
observation/food and water consumption log.  
 
On November 24, 2023, another animal care technician went into the rabbit room to complete routine checks and 
observations. All the rabbits, including Rabbit #345, were observed and fed. The animal care technician identified that 
Rabbit # 345 did not receive routine checks and observations the day prior based upon the November 23rd log entry. The 
animal care technician notified the RAF Supervisor and RAF Management, who notified the Principal Investigator and 
Attending Veterinarian. The clinical veterinary staff reviewed Rabbit #345 and determined it was in good health.  
 
Daily observation of all animals to assess their health and well-being; provided, however, that daily observations of 
animals may be accomplished by someone other than the attending veterinarian is required so that timely and accurate 
information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian.  
 
Corrected before the time of inspection through retraining all animal care staff on December 14, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
